results.title: Foods and nutrition
results.brief_description: A study of the metabolic processes of the body, illustrated by animated diagrams showing the distribution of carbohydrates, proteins, fats, minerals, and vitamins, and by experiments carried out on white mice.

results.title: Foods and fun: a nutrition adventure
results.creator_credit: Rick Reinert and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: Animated film explaining the basics of good health: rest, exercise and a balanced diet. Stresses the need to start the day with a good breakfast. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Food: the story of a peanut butter sandwich
results.creator_credit: George Kaczender, International Cinemedia Center and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: At a children’s party a contest is held to see who can make the most interesting sandwich. The popularity of peanut butter leads to an inquiry into food processing, its mechanics and economics. The filmmaker poses questions to the children about the origin of food, especially peanut butter, filling in the historical, geographic, cultural and other factors.

results.title: Food that builds good health
results.brief_description: A young boy called Art is not eating a balanced diet, so is weak and lethargic. A school demonstration with two guinea pigs on different diets convinces Art that he should change his eating habits.

results.title: Food safety guidelines for community food events
results.brief_description: This video is designed to instruct people involved in producing food for community events such as fetes, festivals and food fairs, in its safe preparation, storage and cooking. It provides advice on ways to prevent contamination of food and is accompanied by pads of mini-posters (for distribution), reminding people of the basics of food safety. Kit contains a video cassette and two booklets.

results.title: Food handling
results.creator_credit: Kathleen O'Brien and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Contrasts the healthy interior of a clean restaurant with the conditions of a careless eating-house. Shows the use of mechanised handling of food and stainless steel containers for hygiene.

results.title: Food gathering
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Indians of the Orinoco: the Makiritare”.
Records how the Waika and Makiritare Indians of South America gather some of their food from the jungle. Includes catching of snakes, fish and worms and their preparation for eating and the collection of leaves which are beaten and mashed and used ingeniously to catch fish. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Food for thought
results.creator_credit: T.A. Abraham, K Khandpur, Indian Film Unit and UNICEF
results.brief_description: This prize-winning film illustrates the problems of the rural community of Orissa as it strives to combat hunger and malnutrition by use of improved methods of poultry and fish farming, cultivation of school gardens and nutrition education.

results.title: Food for life
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Living Body”.
Designed for the 11 to 14 age group this film uses x-ray sequences and demonstrations on the living body to show the processes of digestion.

results.title: Food for health
results.creator_credit: Joseph Cote, Joe Hayward and Moreland-Latchford Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cooking, home economics”.
Presents six concepts conerning foods: a balanced diet, proteins and minerals, carbohydrates and fats, vitamins, food guides and calories. Suitable for secondary level.
